[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Cross-Function] [Race Condition] If ChangeMethodFeeController() and SetMethodFee() are called in the same block, can the authorization check in SetMethodFee() use the old controller while the state uses the new controller? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Cross-Function] [Initialization Gap] Between contract deployment and the first call to RequiredMethodFeeControllerSet(), is there a window where State.MethodFeeController.Value is null and can be exploited? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Cross-Function] [Governance Deadlock] If the Parliament contract is upgraded or removed after controller initialization, can this brick the method fee controller permanently? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Cross-Function] [Fee Evasion] Can a user craft transactions that call the hardcoded fee-free methods (ClaimTransactionFees, etc.) as proxies to expensive operations, bypassing fees? (High)

(Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Input Validation] [MethodFees Structure] Does input.Fees in SetMethodFee() have a maximum length limit, or can an attacker submit thousands of fee tokens to cause gas exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Input Validation] [Symbol Length] Are there restrictions on the length of symbolToAmount.Symbol in SetMethodFee(), or can extremely long symbols cause storage issues? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Input Validation] [Method Name] Does SetMethodFee() validate that input.MethodName matches the contract's actual method signature format, or can arbitrary strings be used? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Input Validation] [AuthorityInfo Validation] In ChangeMethodFeeController(), is there validation that input.OwnerAddress and input.ContractAddress are not equal, preventing self-referential authority? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Input Validation] [Protobuf Defaults] If input parameters are submitted with protobuf default values (empty strings, null addresses), how does the contract handle them? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Error Handling] [Assert vs Require] The code uses Assert() for validation - if Assert throws but doesn't revert state changes, can partial state updates cause inconsistency? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_ACS1_MethodFeeProvider.cs] [Edge Case] [Empty Fees List] Can SetMethodFee() be called with input.Fees as an empty list to effectively remove fees for a method, and is this intentional? (Medium)
